conclusion: Determine the time t_1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder using equations of motion under free fall.
The distance the top of the rod needs to fall to reach the top of the cylinder is 20 m.
Using the equation of motion s = (1/2) g t^2, find the time t_1' it takes for the top of the rod to reach the top of the cylinder: t_1' = 2 s.
The distance the bottom of the rod needs to fall to reach the top of the cylinder is 25 m.
Using the equation of motion s = (1/2) g t^2, find the time t_2' it takes for the bottom of the rod to reach the top of the cylinder: t_2' = sqrt(5) s.

The time t_1 is the difference between the time it takes for the bottom of the rod to reach the top of the cylinder and the time it takes for the top of the rod to reach the top of the cylinder: t_1 = sqrt(5) - 2 s.
The time t_1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder is sqrt(5) - 2 s.
